page.title: 09MARKET RASEN-TRANSPORT
page.content: The town is fortunate to have regular train and bus services. The former includes a through HST to London Kings Cross and return each day.All services are between Grimsby and Lincoln and most connect with trains to London, Nottingham or Sheffield. There are no freight facilities left at Rasen although regular trains of oil-tanks to and from Immingham refineries. Buses connect the town with Lincoln and Grimsby. The two main roads through the area give good routes to Humberside (including the Humber Bridge) in the N., and Lincoln ,East Anglia and Nottingham in the S.(A46); and Yorkshire and the N. and the east coast (A631). The motorway system is only 20 miles away(M180/M18/M1/A1).The town is very busy in summer months with holiday traffic to Skegness etc.
